trans-unit.source: Step 8: Connect the Components on the Bridge Configuration Surface
trans-unit.target: Step 8: Connect the Components on the Bridge Configuration Surface

trans-unit.source: The previous steps in this tutorial demonstrated how to add an FTP source, an LOB component, and a one-way bridge to <token>msgflow</token> surface.
trans-unit.target: The previous steps in this tutorial demonstrated how to add an FTP source, an LOB component, and a one-way bridge to <token>msgflow</token> surface.

trans-unit.source: This step demonstrates how to connect all these components to create an end-to-end message flow.
trans-unit.target: This step demonstrates how to connect all these components to create an end-to-end message flow.

trans-unit.source: To connect the components on the bridge design surface
trans-unit.target: To connect the components on the bridge design surface

trans-unit.source: Open the MessageFlowItinerary.bcs file in the <embeddedLabel>FlatFile_Bridge</embeddedLabel> project.
trans-unit.target: Open the MessageFlowItinerary.bcs file in the <embeddedLabel>FlatFile_Bridge</embeddedLabel> project.

trans-unit.source: From the <embeddedLabel>Toolbox</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Connection</embeddedLabel>, and drag-drop the mouse pointer from the FTP Source component to the bridge component to connect the two.
trans-unit.target: From the <embeddedLabel>Toolbox</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Connection</embeddedLabel>, and drag-drop the mouse pointer from the FTP Source component to the bridge component to connect the two.

trans-unit.source: Repeat this step to connect the bridge component to the <token>lobrelay</token> component.
trans-unit.target: Repeat this step to connect the bridge component to the <token>lobrelay</token> component.

trans-unit.source: Set the filter condition on the connection between the bridge and the <token>lobrelay</token> entity.
trans-unit.target: Set the filter condition on the connection between the bridge and the <token>lobrelay</token> entity.

trans-unit.source: Click the connection between <token>one-way</token> and the <token>lobrelay</token> entity.
trans-unit.target: Click the connection between <token>one-way</token> and the <token>lobrelay</token> entity.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> window, click the ellipsis <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> button for <embeddedLabel>Filter Condition</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> window, click the ellipsis <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> button for <embeddedLabel>Filter Condition</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Route Filter Configuration</embeddedLabel> dialog box, set the filter condition to <embeddedLabel>Match All</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Route Filter Configuration</embeddedLabel> dialog box, set the filter condition to <embeddedLabel>Match All</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: This ensures that all the messages that are processed through the bridge are routed to the LOB entity.
trans-unit.target: This ensures that all the messages that are processed through the bridge are routed to the LOB entity.

trans-unit.source: Click <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Click <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Set the Route action so that the outgoing message to the LOB application has the appropriate SOAP action header.
trans-unit.target: Set the Route action so that the outgoing message to the LOB application has the appropriate SOAP action header.

trans-unit.source: Open <embeddedLabel>Server Explorer</embeddedLabel> and navigate to the SQL <token>lobrelay</token> created earlier.
trans-unit.target: Open <embeddedLabel>Server Explorer</embeddedLabel> and navigate to the SQL <token>lobrelay</token> created earlier.

trans-unit.source: Right click the relay, click <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, and for the <embeddedLabel>Operations</embeddedLabel> property, copy the value of the first operation.
trans-unit.target: Right click the relay, click <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, and for the <embeddedLabel>Operations</embeddedLabel> property, copy the value of the first operation.

trans-unit.source: This value denotes the value of the SOAP action header that must be set on the message that is routed to the <token>lobrelay</token>.
trans-unit.target: This value denotes the value of the SOAP action header that must be set on the message that is routed to the <token>lobrelay</token>.

trans-unit.source: On the <token>msgflow</token> surface, click the connection between <token>one-way</token> and the <token>lobrelay</token> entity.
trans-unit.target: On the <token>msgflow</token> surface, click the connection between <token>one-way</token> and the <token>lobrelay</token> entity.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> window, click the ellipsis <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> button for <embeddedLabel>Route Action</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> window, click the ellipsis <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> button for <embeddedLabel>Route Action</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Route Actions</embeddedLabel> dialog box, click <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel> to open the <embeddedLabel>Add Route Action</embeddedLabel> dialog box.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Route Actions</embeddedLabel> dialog box, click <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel> to open the <embeddedLabel>Add Route Action</embeddedLabel> dialog box.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Add Route Action</embeddedLabel> dialog box, do the following:
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Add Route Action</embeddedLabel> dialog box, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Under <embeddedLabel>Property (Read From)</embeddedLabel> section, select <embeddedLabel>Expression</embeddedLabel>, and then paste the value that you copied earlier.
trans-unit.target: Under <embeddedLabel>Property (Read From)</embeddedLabel> section, select <embeddedLabel>Expression</embeddedLabel>, and then paste the value that you copied earlier.

trans-unit.source: You must always specify the value for an expression within single quotes.
trans-unit.target: You must always specify the value for an expression within single quotes.

trans-unit.source: Under <embeddedLabel>Destination (Write To)</embeddedLabel> section, set the Type to <embeddedLabel>SOAP</embeddedLabel> and the <embeddedLabel>Identifier</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>Action</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Under <embeddedLabel>Destination (Write To)</embeddedLabel> section, set the Type to <embeddedLabel>SOAP</embeddedLabel> and the <embeddedLabel>Identifier</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>Action</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The dialog box resembles the following:
trans-unit.target: The dialog box resembles the following:

trans-unit.source: Click <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> in the <embeddedLabel>Add Route Action</embeddedLabel> dialog box to add the route action.
trans-unit.target: Click <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> in the <embeddedLabel>Add Route Action</embeddedLabel> dialog box to add the route action.

trans-unit.source: Click <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> in the <embeddedLabel>Route Actions</embeddedLabel> dialog box and then click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel> to save changes to an <token>msgflow_proj</token>.
trans-unit.target: Click <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> in the <embeddedLabel>Route Actions</embeddedLabel> dialog box and then click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel> to save changes to an <token>msgflow_proj</token>.

trans-unit.source: The end-to-end message flow resembles the following:
trans-unit.target: The end-to-end message flow resembles the following:

trans-unit.source: Save changes to the project.
trans-unit.target: Save changes to the project.
